page.title: 13Coastal path near Porthpean
page.content: We started at Duporth holiday village and went south along the coastal path. There was a lot of wild flowers along the path such as:Red campions, Daffodils and Bluebells.On the way to Porthpean we saw an old World War Two lookout tower.From it we could see all of St.Austell Bay and a long way out to sea.Next we walked across Porthpean beach,stopping only to admire the view.We walked up the hill,through several fields of sheep.We saw a ship waiting to go into a harbour,it was very careful not to get tangled in the lobster pots.When we got to Black Head ,we saw the firing range,and fortunatlly there was nobody shooting their so we went to see it at closer detail.
